original: de nas 'dod pa na spyod pa dang / gzugs yod pa na spyod pa'i lha'i bu de dag gis ched du brjod pa ched du brjod de /
analyzed: de nas 'dod pa na spyod pa dang / gzugs yod pa na spyod pa'i lha'i bu de dag gis ched du brjod pa ched du brjod de /

analyzed: 'di lta ste / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni /

analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa chen mo ste /

original: @402b bcom ldan 'das /üîΩ'di ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni /
analyzed: @402b bcom ldan 'das / 'di ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni /

analyzed: dpag tu ma mchis pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o // 'di ni gzhal du ma mchis pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //

original: 'di ni mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ni mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ste /

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One!

analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo de la bslabs shing / dad pa'i rjes su 'brang ba rnams byung bar 'gyur te /

original: byung zhing 'byung bar 'gyur /
analyzed: byung zhing 'byung bar 'gyur /

original: chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba dang / brgyad pa dang / rgyun du zhugs pa dang / lan gcig phyir 'ong ba dang / phyir mi 'ong ba dang / dgra bcom pa rnams byung bar gyur te /
analyzed: chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba dang / brgyad pa dang / rgyun du zhugs pa dang / lan gcig phyir 'ong ba dang / phyir mi 'ong ba dang / dgra bcom pa rnams byung bar gyur te /

original: byung zhing 'byung 'gyur; de la bslabs shing rang sangs rgyas rnams byung bar gyur te /
analyzed: byung zhing 'byung 'gyur; de la bslabs shing rang sangs rgyas rnams byung bar gyur te /

original: byung zhing 'byung bar 'gyur /
analyzed: byung zhing 'byung bar 'gyur /

original: de la bslabs shing byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu byung bar gyur te /
analyzed: de la bslabs shing byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu byung bar gyur te /

original: byung zhing 'byung bar 'gyur yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di 'grib pa'am /
analyzed: byung zhing 'byung bar 'gyur yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di 'grib pa'am /
translated: Even though they have appeared, and will appear, this very profound perfection of wisdom does not decrease or increase.‚Äù

original: 'phel par yang mi gda'o zhes nas 'dod pa na spyod pa dang / gzugs yod pa na spyod pa'i lha'i bu de dag gis bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs gnyis la spyi bos phyag btsal te /
analyzed: 'phel par yang mi gda'o zhes nas 'dod pa na spyod pa dang / gzugs yod pa na spyod pa'i lha'i bu de dag gis bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs gnyis la spyi bos phyag btsal te /
translated: Then the gods living in the desire realm and the gods living in the form realm bowed their heads to the BhagavƒÅn‚Äôs feet,

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la lan gsum du g-yas phyogs nas bskor nas /

analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i lha'i bu dag ni @403a *//

analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams su 'khod do //

analyzed: gzugs yod pa na spyod pa'i lha'i bu dag ni gzugs yod pa'i khams su 'khod do //
translated: The sons of gods who move in the form realm settled in the form realm.

analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis; bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then the venerable Subh≈´ti said to the Lord:

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di thos ma thag tu mos bar 'gyur zhing /

analyzed: gong du 'dri ba dang / 'dzin pa dang / 'chang ba dang / klog pa dang / kun chub par bgyid cing /

analyzed: de gang nas shi 'phos te 'dir skyes par gyur pa lags /

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /

analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di thos ma thag tu mos shing zhum par mi 'gyur /
translated: ‚ÄúSubh≈´ti, those bodhisattva great beings who, as soon as they hear this perfection of wisdom, have confidence in it and do not become cowed,

analyzed: yongs su zhum par mi 'gyur la /

original: rmongs par mi 'gyur zhing the tshom mi za /
analyzed: rmongs par mi 'gyur zhing the tshom mi za /

original: nem nur mi byed la /
analyzed: nem nur mi byed la /

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di nyan par mngon par dga' zhing /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di nyan par mngon par dga' zhing /

analyzed: yid la bya ba de dag 'gro 'am / 'ong ngam / 'greng ngam /

analyzed: 'dug gam; nyal kyang rung ste /

analyzed: chos smra ba'i gang zag de la'ang rtag tu rgyun mi chad par 'brang ste /

original: rab 'byor / dper na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / dper na /
translated: Subh≈´ti, it is like this:

original: ba drus ma be'u mi @403b 'dor ba ltar /
analyzed: ba drus ma be'u mi @403b 'dor ba ltar /

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di'i don du /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di'i don du /
translated: In the same way, Subh≈´ti, bodhisattva great beings should not abandon the Dharma teacher for the sake of this deep perfection of wisdom.

original: nam shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni mngon du ma byas /
analyzed: nam shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni mngon du ma byas /
translated: ‚ÄúSubh≈´ti, until they have actualized this perfection of wisdom,

original: dran pas 'dris par ma byas /
analyzed: dran pas 'dris par ma byas /

original: yid kyis rtogs par ma byas /
analyzed: yid kyis rtogs par ma byas /

analyzed: lta bas khong du chud par ma byas kyi bar du chos smra ba de mi gtong na /

analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa'i gang zag de ni mi'i nang nas shi 'phos nas /

analyzed: mi'i nang du skyes pa'o //

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /

original: de ni 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa'i rigs kyi bu des sngon yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di thos nas bzung ba dang; bcangs pa dang / bklags pa dang / kun chub par byas pa dang / tshul bzhin du yid la byas par gyur to //
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa'i rigs kyi bu des sngon yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di thos nas bzung ba dang; bcangs pa dang / bklags pa dang / kun chub par byas pa dang / tshul bzhin du yid la byas par gyur to //
translated: It is because those sons of a good family in the vehicle of the bodhisattvas have previously heard this perfection of wisdom, and have taken it up, borne it in mind, read it aloud, mastered it, and properly paid attention to it.

original: gong du'ang bris shing glegs bam du byas te /
analyzed: gong du'ang bris shing glegs bam du byas te /

original: me tog dang / phreng ba dang / spos dang / byug pa dang / phye ma dang / na bza' dang / gdugs dang / rgyal mtshan dang / ba dan mang pos rim gror byas par gyur to //
analyzed: me tog dang / phreng ba dang / spos dang / byug pa dang / phye ma dang / na bza' dang / gdugs dang / rgyal mtshan dang / ba dan mang pos rim gror byas par gyur to //
translated: They have honored it with many flowers, garlands, perfume, ointments, aromatic powders, clothes, parasols, victory banners, and flags.

original: bkur sti dang / bsti stang dang / mchod pa byas par gyur to; ;dge ba'i rtsa ba de nyid kyis mi'i nang nas shi 'phos nas mi'i nang du skyes te /
analyzed: bkur sti dang / bsti stang dang / mchod pa byas par gyur to; ;dge ba'i rtsa ba de nyid kyis mi'i nang nas shi 'phos nas mi'i nang du skyes te /

analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la'ang thos ma thag tu mos par 'gyur bar lta'o //

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: He said, ‚ÄúBlessed One,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di thos ma thag tu mos shing mos par gyur nas kyang 'dri ba dang / bris nas kyang lung @404a *//
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di thos ma thag tu mos shing mos par gyur nas kyang 'dri ba dang / bris nas kyang lung @404a *//

analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gzhan dag la bsnyen bkur bgyid bgyid pa las shi 'phos te /

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /

analyzed: rab 'byor / de de bzhin no //

original: de de bzhin te /

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di thos ma thag tu mos par 'gyur ro //üîΩmos par gyur nas kyang 'dri'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di thos ma thag tu mos par 'gyur ro // mos par gyur nas kyang 'dri'o //

analyzed: bris nas kyang lung 'bog go /

original: kha ton byed do //
analyzed: kha ton byed do //

analyzed: tshul bzhin du yid la byed do //

analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / de ni 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po des sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag las /

analyzed: kha ton du byas so //

analyzed: tshul bzhin du yid la byas so //

translated: ‚ÄúMoreover, Subh≈´ti, when bodhisattva great beings who have died among the Tu·π£ita devas are reborn in the human realm with the same fortune,

analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /

translated: Subh≈´ti, it is because those bodhisattva great beings have asked questions about and investigated this deep perfection of wisdom with the bodhisattva great being Maitreya, and so they should be known to have been born here through that wholesome root.

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang gang zag byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa gang gis /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang gang zag byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa gang gis /

analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa thos nas kyang yongs su ma dris /

analyzed: sems kyi rnam pa gzhan du 'gyur ro //

analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di la gang @419b zag byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa thog mar thabs dang ldan par sbyin pa yongs su gtong /
translated: Subh≈´ti, here a person in the Bodhisattva Vehicle, from the very beginning, gives gifts with skillful means,

original: thabs dang ldan par tshul khrims srung /
analyzed: thabs dang ldan par tshul khrims srung /
translated: guards morality with skillful means,

original: thabs dang ldan par bzod pa sgom /
analyzed: thabs dang ldan par bzod pa sgom /
translated: cultivates patience with skillful means,

original: thabs dang ldan par brtson 'grus rtsom /
analyzed: thabs dang ldan par brtson 'grus rtsom /
translated: makes an effort with vigor with skillful means,

original: thabs dang ldan par bsam gtan rnams la snyoms par 'jug /
analyzed: thabs dang ldan par bsam gtan rnams la snyoms par 'jug /
translated: becomes absorbed in concentration with skillful means,

original: thabs dang ldan par shes rab sgom zhing /üîΩ'di ltar bdag ni sbyin pa yongs su gtong ngo //
analyzed: thabs dang ldan par shes rab sgom zhing / 'di ltar bdag ni sbyin pa yongs su gtong ngo //
translated: and cultivates wisdom with skillful means.üîΩThey think, ‚ÄòI am giving a gift.

original: sbyin pa 'di yongs su gtong ngo //
analyzed: sbyin pa 'di yongs su gtong ngo //
translated: I am giving this gift.

original: 'di la sbyin pa yongs su gtong ngo snyam du mi sems so //üîΩ'di ltar bdag ni tshul khrims srung ngo //
analyzed: 'di la sbyin pa yongs su gtong ngo snyam du mi sems so // 'di ltar bdag ni tshul khrims srung ngo //
translated: He does not think, ‚ÄúI am giving a gift.‚ÄùüîΩHe does not think, ‚ÄúI am guarding morality.‚Äù

original: tshul khrims ni 'di srung ngo snyam du mi sems so //üîΩ'di ltar bdag ni bzod pa sgom mo //
analyzed: tshul khrims ni 'di srung ngo snyam du mi sems so // 'di ltar bdag ni bzod pa sgom mo //
translated: He does not think, ‚ÄúThis is morality that I am guarding.‚ÄùüîΩHe does not think, ‚ÄúI am cultivating patience.‚Äù

original: bzod pa ni 'di sgom mo snyam du mi sems so //üîΩ'di ltar bdag ni brtson 'grus rtsom mo //
analyzed: bzod pa ni 'di sgom mo snyam du mi sems so // 'di ltar bdag ni brtson 'grus rtsom mo //
translated: He does not think, ‚ÄúThis is patience that I am cultivating.‚ÄùüîΩHe does not think, ‚ÄúI am undertaking perseverance.‚Äù

original: brtson 'grus ni 'di rtsom mo snyam du mi sems so //üîΩ'di ltar bdag ni bsam gtan dag la snyoms par 'jug go /
analyzed: brtson 'grus ni 'di rtsom mo snyam du mi sems so // 'di ltar bdag ni bsam gtan dag la snyoms par 'jug go /
translated: He does not think, ‚ÄúThis is perseverance that I am undertaking.‚ÄùüîΩHe does not think, ‚ÄúI am cultivating concentration.‚Äù

original: bsam gtan ni 'di dag la snyoms par 'jug go snyam du mi sems so //üîΩ'di ltar bdag ni shes rab sgom mo //
analyzed: bsam gtan ni 'di dag la snyoms par 'jug go snyam du mi sems so // 'di ltar bdag ni shes rab sgom mo //
translated: He does not think, ‚ÄúThis is concentration that I am cultivating.‚ÄùüîΩHe does not think, ‚ÄúI am cultivating wisdom.‚Äù

original: shes rab ni 'di sgom mo snyam du mi sems so //
analyzed: shes rab ni 'di sgom mo snyam du mi sems so //
translated: He does not think, ‚ÄúThis is wisdom that I am cultivating.‚Äù

original: de sbyin pa rlom sems su mi byed /üîΩsbyin pas rlom sems su mi byed /
analyzed: de sbyin pa rlom sems su mi byed / sbyin pas rlom sems su mi byed /
translated: He does not falsely project generosity.üîΩHe does not falsely project the thought of generosity.

original: bdag ni sbyin pa byed pa'o zhes rlom sems su mi byed do //
analyzed: bdag ni sbyin pa byed pa'o zhes rlom sems su mi byed do //
translated: He does not falsely project the thought, ‚ÄúI am generous.‚Äù

original: de tshul khrims rlom sems su mi byed /
analyzed: de tshul khrims rlom sems su mi byed /
translated: He does not falsely project morality.

original: tshul khrims kyis rlom sems su mi byed /
analyzed: tshul khrims kyis rlom sems su mi byed /
translated: They do not become proud because of their discipline.

original: bdag ni tshul khrims dang ldan pa'o zhes rlom sems su mi byed do //üîΩde bzod pa rlom sems su mi byed /
analyzed: bdag ni tshul khrims dang ldan pa'o zhes rlom sems su mi byed do // de bzod pa rlom sems su mi byed /

original: bzod pas rlom sems su mi byed /
analyzed: bzod pas rlom sems su mi byed /
translated: They do not become proud because of patience.

original: bdag ni bzod pa dang ldan pa'o zhes rlom sems su mi byed do //üîΩ@420a *// de brtson 'grus rlom sems su mi byed /
analyzed: bdag ni bzod pa dang ldan pa'o zhes rlom sems su mi byed do // @420a *// de brtson 'grus rlom sems su mi byed /
translated: They do not become proud, thinking, ‚ÄòI am patient.‚ÄôüîΩThey do not become proud because of their diligence.

original: brtson 'grus kyis rlom sems su mi byed /
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyis rlom sems su mi byed /
translated: They do not become proud because of diligence.

original: bdag ni brtson 'grus dang ldan pa'o zhes rlom sems su mi byed do //üîΩde bsam gtan rlom sems su mi byed /
analyzed: bdag ni brtson 'grus dang ldan pa'o zhes rlom sems su mi byed do // de bsam gtan rlom sems su mi byed /
translated: They do not become proud, thinking, ‚ÄòI am diligent.‚ÄôüîΩThey do not become proud because of their concentration.

original: bsam gtan gyis rlom sems su mi byed /
analyzed: bsam gtan gyis rlom sems su mi byed /

original: bdag ni bsam gtan pa'o zhes rlom sems su mi byed do //üîΩde shes rab rlom sems su mi byed /
analyzed: bdag ni bsam gtan pa'o zhes rlom sems su mi byed do // de shes rab rlom sems su mi byed /
translated: They do not become proud, thinking, ‚ÄòI am concentrated.‚ÄôüîΩThey do not become proud because of their insight.

original: shes rab kyis rlom sems su mi byed /
analyzed: shes rab kyis rlom sems su mi byed /
translated: They do not become proud because of insight.

original: bdag ni shes rab dang ldan pa'o zhes rlom sems su mi byed do //
analyzed: bdag ni shes rab dang ldan pa'o zhes rlom sems su mi byed do //
translated: They do not become proud, thinking, ‚ÄòI am insightful.‚Äô

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: de ltar de rnam par mi rtog pas /
analyzed: de ltar de rnam par mi rtog pas /
translated: Because they are free from conceptualization.

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la rnam par rtog par de dag med de /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la rnam par rtog par de dag med de /
translated: ‚ÄúThere are no such concepts in the perfection of generosity.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: de ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de ni 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa de ni pha rol tu phyin pa med pa'o //üîΩde ltar de rnam par mi rtog pas /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa de ni pha rol tu phyin pa med pa'o // de ltar de rnam par mi rtog pas /
translated: The perfection of generosity is not a perfection.

original: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la rnam par rtog pa de dag med de /
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la rnam par rtog pa de dag med de /
translated: In that way, there are no such concepts in the perfection of morality, the perfection of patience, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of concentration, or the perfection of wisdom.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: de ni 'di ltar 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de ni pha rol tu phyin pa med pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de ni pha rol tu phyin pa med pa'o //
translated: The perfection of wisdom is not a perfection.

original: de lta'ang yin la gang zag byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa de'ang ring du song ba shes shing pha rol shes kyang de rlom sems med de /
analyzed: de lta'ang yin la gang zag byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa de'ang ring du song ba shes shing pha rol shes kyang de rlom sems med de /

translated: and the perfection of generosity, and the perfection of moral discipline, and the perfection of patience, and the perfection of perseverance, and the perfection of concentration,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas yongs su bzung zhing /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas yongs su bzung zhing /

original: bcom ldan 'das las dang po pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos ji ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bgyi /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das las dang po pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos ji ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bgyi /
translated: The Lord: How should a Bodhisattva, a great being, a beginner train in the perfection of wisdom?

original: ji ltar bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol phyin pa dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bgyi /üîΩbcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: ji ltar bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol phyin pa dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bgyi / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: How in the perfection of concentration, the perfection of vigour, the perfection of patience, the perfection of morality, and the perfection of giving?

original: rab 'byor / 'di la las dang po pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par 'dod pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di la las dang po pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par 'dod pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang /
translated: The Lord: Here, Subhuti, a beginner Bodhisattva, a great being, who wants to train in the perfection of wisdom, in the perfection of concentration, the perfection of vigour, the perfection of patience, the perfection of morality, and the perfection of giving, should, in the morning, having risen, recollect the Tathagatas, Arhats, Fully Enlightened Ones, who are gone to Parinirvana, in the ten directions, and whose number is as vast as the great trichiliocosm is vast, and think: 'How deep is the Dharma of those Exalted Ones, how deep is the Dharma of those Exalted Ones!'

original: bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par 'dod pas /
analyzed: bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par 'dod pas /
translated: Those who wish to train in the perfection of patience, the perfection of morality, and the perfection of generosity

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen @421a *//
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen @421a *//
translated: should rely on a spiritual friend

original: gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ston pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang /
analyzed: gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ston pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang /
translated: who teaches the perfection of wisdom, the perfection of meditative stability, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of patience, the perfection of morality,üîΩand the perfection of generosity.

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ston pa de dag la bsten par bya'o //
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ston pa de dag la bsten par bya'o //
translated: They should serve them

original: bsnyen bkur bya'o //
analyzed: bsnyen bkur bya'o //
translated: and venerate them.

original: de dag de la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ltar ston te /
analyzed: de dag de la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ltar ston te /
translated: They teach this perfection of wisdom to them like this:

original: tshur rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: tshur rigs kyi bu /
translated: ‚ÄòCome, son of noble family!

original: sbyin pa gang dang gang sbyin pa de thams cad bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngos shig /
analyzed: sbyin pa gang dang gang sbyin pa de thams cad bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngos shig /
translated: Dedicate all the generosity you practice to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: tshur rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: tshur rigs kyi bu /
translated: Come, son of noble family!

original: tshul khrims gang dang gang srung pa dang / bzod pa gang dang gang sgrub pa dang / brtson 'grus gang dang gang rtsom pa dang / bsam gtan gang dang gang la snyoms par 'jug pa dang / shes rab gang dang gang sgom pa de thams cad bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngos shig /
analyzed: tshul khrims gang dang gang srung pa dang / bzod pa gang dang gang sgrub pa dang / brtson 'grus gang dang gang rtsom pa dang / bsam gtan gang dang gang la snyoms par 'jug pa dang / shes rab gang dang gang sgom pa de thams cad bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngos shig /
translated: Whatever morality you guard, whatever patience you practice, whatever effort you undertake, whatever meditation you enter into, whatever wisdom you cultivate, dedicate it all to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: rigs kyi bu khyod bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub gzugs su rtog par ma byed cig /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu khyod bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub gzugs su rtog par ma byed cig /
translated: Son of noble family, do not conceive of unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening as form.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes par rtog par ma byed cig /
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes par rtog par ma byed cig /
translated: Do not conceive of it as feeling, perception, formation, or consciousness.

original: skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung bar rtog par ma byed cig /
analyzed: skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung bar rtog par ma byed cig /
translated: Do not conceive of it as the sense spheres, elements, or dependent origination.

original: rigs kyi bu khyod bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu @421b phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang /üîΩbsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin par rtog par ma byed cig ;rigs kyi bu khyod bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub nang stong pa nyid du rtog par ma byed cig /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu khyod bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu @421b phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin par rtog par ma byed cig ;rigs kyi bu khyod bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub nang stong pa nyid du rtog par ma byed cig /
translated: ‚ÄúNoble son, do not conceptualize unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening as the perfection of generosity, the perfection of conduct, the perfection of patience, the perfection of perseverance,üîΩthe perfection of concentration, or the perfection of wisdom. Noble son, do not conceptualize unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening as inner emptiness,

translated: The non-connection of consciousness is the non-arising of consciousness.

original: rnam par shes pa'i skye ba med pa gang yin pa de ni rnam par shes pa'i 'gag pa med pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i skye ba med pa gang yin pa de ni rnam par shes pa'i 'gag pa med pa'o //
translated: The emptiness of the eyes is not the eyes.üîΩThe emptiness of the ears, nose, tongue, body, and mind is not the ears, nose, tongue, body, and mind.üîΩThe emptiness of form is not form.üîΩThe emptiness of sound, smell, taste, touch, and phenomena is not sound, smell, taste, touch, and phenomena.

original: rnam par shes pa'i 'gag pa med pa gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i 'gag pa med pa gang yin pa de ni /
translated: The emptiness of the eye constituent is not the eye constituent.üîΩThe emptiness of the ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind constituents is not the ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind constituents.üîΩThe emptiness of the form constituent is not the form constituent.üîΩThe emptiness of the sound, smell, taste, touch, and mental-object constituents is not the sound, smell, taste, touch, and mental-object constituents.

original: rnam par shes pa'i 'dre ba med pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i 'dre ba med pa'o //
translated: The emptiness of the eye-consciousness constituent is not the eye-consciousness constituent.üîΩThe emptiness of the ear-, nose-, tongue-, body-, and thinking-mind-consciousness constituents is not the ear-, nose-, tongue-, body-, and thinking-mind-consciousness constituents.üîΩThe emptiness of the eye-contact constituent is not the eye-contact constituent.üîΩThe emptiness of ear-, nose-, tongue-, body-, and thinking-mind-contact constituents is not the ear-, nose-, tongue-, body-, and thinking-mind-contact constituents.üîΩThe emptiness of the feeling constituent is not the feeling constituent.üîΩThe emptiness of the craving constituent is not the craving constituent.üîΩThe emptiness of the appropriation constituent is not the appropriation constituent.üîΩThe emptiness of the becoming constituent is not the becoming constituent.

original: skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dang / pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun dang / 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi dang /
analyzed: skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dang / pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun dang / 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi dang /
translated: The emptiness of the birth constituent is not the birth constituent.üîΩThe emptiness of aging and death is not aging and death.üîΩThe emptiness of suffering is not suffering.üîΩThe emptiness of origination is not origination.üîΩThe emptiness of cessation is not cessation.üîΩThe emptiness of the path is not the path.üîΩThe emptiness of knowledge is not knowledge.

original: bsam gtan bzhi dang / tshad med pa bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi dang / rnam @427b par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang /
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi dang / tshad med pa bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi dang / rnam @427b par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang /
translated: The emptiness of ignorance is not ignorance.üîΩThe emptiness of the eye is not the eye.üîΩThe emptiness of the ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind is not the ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind.

original: mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa rnams dang / ting nge 'dzin rnams dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang /üîΩbyams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar gyi 'dre ba med pa gang yin pa de ni /üîΩrnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi 'brel pa med pa'o //üîΩrnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi 'brel pa med pa gang yin pa de ni /

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi 'gag pa med pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi 'gag pa med pa'o //
translated: the non-cessation of the knowledge of all modes,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi 'gag pa med pa gang yin pa de ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi 'dre ba med pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi 'gag pa med pa gang yin pa de ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi 'dre ba med pa'o //
translated: the non-interruption of the knowledge of all modes,

original: rab 'byor / de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'dod pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'dod pa /
translated: Subhuti, thus should a Bodhisattva, a great being, who wants to fully know the supreme enlightenment,

original: chos thams cad 'dre ba med par chos ston to //üîΩrab 'byor / ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla na med pa yang dag @428a *//üîΩpar rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'dod pa /
analyzed: chos thams cad 'dre ba med par chos ston to // rab 'byor / ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla na med pa yang dag @428a *// par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'dod pa /
translated: teach the Dharma to the beings without mixing up the dharmas.

original: sems can rnams kyi dpung gnyen du gyur pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi dpung gnyen du gyur pa yin zhe na /
translated: How, Subhuti, does a Bodhisattva, a great being, who wants to fully know the supreme enlightenment, become a protector of the unprotected for the beings?

original: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas /
translated: Subhuti: Here a Bodhisattva, a great being, having fully known the utmost, right, and perfect enlightenment,

original: sems can rnams la 'di ltar chos ston te /üîΩgzugs kyi pha rol gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: sems can rnams la 'di ltar chos ston te / gzugs kyi pha rol gang yin pa de ni /
translated: teaches the Dharma to beings in this way:

original: gzugs ma yin no //üîΩtshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa'i pha rol gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: gzugs ma yin no // tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa'i pha rol gang yin pa de ni /
translated: 'The other shore of form is not form.üîΩThe other shore of feeling, perception, volitional formations, and consciousness is not consciousness.

original: rnam par shes pa ma yin no //üîΩskye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i pha rol gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ma yin no // skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i pha rol gang yin pa de ni /
translated: The other shore of the sense fields is not the sense fields.üîΩThe other shore of the elements is not the elements.

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ma yin no //üîΩpha rol tu phyin pa thams cad kyi pha rol gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ma yin no // pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad kyi pha rol gang yin pa de ni /
translated: The other shore of dependent origination is not dependent origination.üîΩThe other shore of the perfections is not the perfections.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa ma yin no //üîΩstong pa nyid thams cad kyi pha rol gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa ma yin no // stong pa nyid thams cad kyi pha rol gang yin pa de ni /
translated: The other shore of the thirty-seven wings of enlightenment is not the thirty-seven wings of enlightenment.üîΩThe other shore of the powers, the grounds of self-confidence, the analytical knowledges, and the eighteen special qualities of a Buddha is not the powers, the grounds of self-confidence, the analytical knowledges, and the eighteen special qualities of a Buddha.üîΩThe other shore of the knowledge of all modes is not the knowledge of all modes.

original: stong pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: stong pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: The other shore of the knowledge of all modes is not the knowledge of all modes.

original: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun gyi pha rol gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun gyi pha rol gang yin pa de ni /
translated: The perfection of the thirty-seven factors of enlightenment isüîΩ

original: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos ma yin no //üîΩ'phags pa'i bden pa rnams dang / bsam gtan rnams dang / tshad med pa rnams dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid @428b dang; mtshan ma med pa dang /
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos ma yin no // 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams dang / bsam gtan rnams dang / tshad med pa rnams dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid @428b dang; mtshan ma med pa dang /
translated: The perfection of the thirty-seven dharmas on the side of awakening is not the thirty-seven dharmas on the side of awakening.

original: smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa rnams dang / ting nge 'dzin rnams dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang /
analyzed: smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa rnams dang / ting nge 'dzin rnams dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang /
translated: The perfection of the four noble truths, the perfection of the four formless concentrations, the perfection of the eight deliverances, the perfection of the nine serial absorptions, the perfection of the emptiness, signlessness, and aspirationlessness that are gateways to liberation, the perfection of the ten powers of the tathƒÅgatas, the perfection of the four fearlessnesses, the perfection of the four detailed and thorough knowledges, the perfection of the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha, the perfection of great love, and the perfection of great compassion is not great compassion.

original: byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi pha rol gang yin pa de ni; sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa ma yin no //üîΩrnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar gyi pha rol gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi pha rol gang yin pa de ni; sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa ma yin no // rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar gyi pha rol gang yin pa de ni /
translated: The perfection of the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha is not the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: The perfection of the knowledge of all aspects is not the knowledge of all aspects.

original: rab 'byor / gzugs ji lta bar chos thams cad kyang de bzhin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzugs ji lta bar chos thams cad kyang de bzhin no //
translated: Subh≈´ti, all dharmas are just like form.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das kyis gzugs ji lta bar chos thams cad kyang de bzhin no zhes bka' stsal na /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das kyis gzugs ji lta bar chos thams cad kyang de bzhin no zhes bka' stsal na /
translated: ‚ÄúLord, if all dharmas are just like form,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Lord,

original: de lta lags na ni /
analyzed: de lta lags na ni /
translated: then

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos chos thams cad mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos chos thams cad mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas par 'gyur ro //
translated: a bodhisattva great being will have fully awakened to all dharmas.

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
translated: Why is it so, Lord?

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Lord,

original: gzugs kyi pha rol na rnam par rtog pa gang yang ma mchis so //
analyzed: gzugs kyi pha rol na rnam par rtog pa gang yang ma mchis so //
translated: there is no conceptualization whatsoever beyond form.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa'i pha rol na rnam par rtog pa gang yang ma mchis so //
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa'i pha rol na rnam par rtog pa gang yang ma mchis so //
translated: There are no conceptualizations whatsoever beyond feeling, perception, volitional factors, or consciousness.

original: skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i pha rol na rnam par rtog pa gang yang ma mchis so //
analyzed: skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i pha rol na rnam par rtog pa gang yang ma mchis so //
translated: There are no conceptualizations whatsoever beyond the sense spheres, elements, or dependent origination.üîΩThere are no conceptualizations whatsoever beyond all the perfections,

original: pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad dang / stong pa nyid @429a *//
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad dang / stong pa nyid @429a *//
translated: all the emptinesses,

original: thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun dang / 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams dang / bsam gtan rnams dang / tshad med pa rnams dang; gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang /
analyzed: thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun dang / 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams dang / bsam gtan rnams dang / tshad med pa rnams dang; gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang /
translated: the thirty-seven dharmas on the side of awakening, the noble truths, the concentrations, the immeasurables, the formless absorptions, the eight deliverances,

original: mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa rnams dang / ting nge 'dzin rnams dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams dang /
analyzed: mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa rnams dang / ting nge 'dzin rnams dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams dang /
translated: the nine serial absorptions, the emptiness gate of liberation, the signlessness gate of liberation, the wishlessness gate of liberation, the clairvoyances, the meditative stabilizations, the dhƒÅra·πáƒ´ gateways,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi pha rol na rnam par rtog pa gang yang ma mchis so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi pha rol na rnam par rtog pa gang yang ma mchis so //
translated: the ten powers of the tathƒÅgatas, the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, great love, great compassion, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha, there are no conceptualizations at all.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar gyi pha rol na rnam par rtog pa gang yang ma mchis te /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar gyi pha rol na rnam par rtog pa gang yang ma mchis te /
translated: Up to and including omniscience, there are no conceptualizations at all.

original: 'di ni gzugs so //
analyzed: 'di ni gzugs so //
translated: This is form.

original: 'di ni tshor ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni tshor ba'o //
translated: This is feeling.

original: 'di ni 'du shes so //
analyzed: 'di ni 'du shes so //
translated: This is perception.

original: 'di ni 'du byed do //
analyzed: 'di ni 'du byed do //
translated: This is volitional factors.

original: 'di ni rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: This is consciousness.

original: 'di ni skye mched do //
analyzed: 'di ni skye mched do //
translated: This is the sense base.

original: 'di ni khams so //
analyzed: 'di ni khams so //
translated: This is the element.

original: 'di ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'o //
translated: This is dependent origination.

original: 'di ni pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad do //
analyzed: 'di ni pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad do //
translated: This is the perfection.

original: 'di ni stong pa nyid thams cad do //
analyzed: 'di ni stong pa nyid thams cad do //
translated: This is the emptiness.

original: 'di ni byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun no //
analyzed: 'di ni byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun no //
translated: This is the thirty-seven factors of awakening.

original: 'di ni 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams so //
analyzed: 'di ni 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams so //
translated: This is the noble truths.

original: 'di ni bsam @429b gtan rnams so //
analyzed: 'di ni bsam @429b gtan rnams so //
translated: This is the concentration.

original: 'di ni tshad med pa rnams so //
analyzed: 'di ni tshad med pa rnams so //
translated: This is the immeasurables.

original: 'di ni gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams so //
analyzed: 'di ni gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams so //
translated: This is the formless absorptions.

original: 'di ni rnam par thar pa brgyad do //
analyzed: 'di ni rnam par thar pa brgyad do //
translated: This is the eight liberations.

analyzed: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la mngon par chags pa med dam zhes bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang /
translated: Subhuti : Here a Bodhisattva, a great being, who courses in the perfection of wisdom, should investigate whether he is really attached to the perfection of wisdom, to the perfection of meditation, to the perfection of energy, to the perfection of patience, to the perfection of morality, to the perfection of giving.

original: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po yongs su brtag par bya'o //

analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po nang stong pa nyid dang / phyi stong pa nyid dang / phyi nang stong pa nyid dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar la mngon par chags pa med dam zhes dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po yongs su brtag par bya'o // byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun la mngon par chags pa med dam zhes /

analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po yongs su brtag par bya'o //

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad la mngon par chags pa med dam zhes sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po yongs su brtag par bya'o //
translated: ‚ÄúShould bodhisattva great beings be examined with regard to the ten tathƒÅgata powers, four fearlessnesses, four detailed and thorough knowledges, great love, great compassion, and eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha, as to whether they are attached to them?‚ÄùüîΩ‚ÄúShould bodhisattva great beings be examined with regard to the knowledge of all aspects, as to whether they are attached to it?‚Äù

translated: ‚ÄúSubh≈´ti, bodhisattva great beings who are irreversible from awakening

analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la spyod pa'i tshe /

translated: ‚ÄúWhen a bodhisattva great being who is irreversible practices this deep perfection of wisdom,

analyzed: bskyed pas 'phrogs pa ma yin nam /
translated: ‚ÄúAre you not carried away by a thought of desire?

analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la spyod pa'i tshe /

analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang bral bar ma gyur tam /

analyzed: klog cing kun chub par byed de /

original: tshul bzhin du yid la byed la /
analyzed: tshul bzhin du yid la byed la /

translated: Su¬≠bh≈´ti, one should know that those bodhisattva great beings have previously asked questions about, and investigated, this profound transcendent perfection of wisdom, and have retained, held, and mastered it.

analyzed: tshul bzhin du yid la byas par rig par bya'o //

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /

translated: ‚ÄúSubh≈´ti, those bodhisattva great beings should investigate this deep perfection of wisdom with a thought directed toward the knowledge of all aspects.üîΩSubh≈´ti said,

analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das / ji ltar na rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la gzhol @449a *//

translated: the intention of being dedicated to suchness, the intention of being dedicated to the dharma-constituent, the intention of being dedicated to the very limit of reality, the intention of being dedicated to the inconceivable element,üîΩand the intention of being dedicated to the unconditioned‚Äî

translated: They are the thought of being absorbed in dreams, in reflections, in echoes, in mirages, in illusions, in magical incarnations.üîΩüîΩThe Perfection of Wisdom in Twenty-Five Thousand LinesüîΩüîΩChapter Twenty-Six: The Perfection of WisdomüîΩüîΩSubh≈´ti said, ‚ÄúLord,üîΩ

original: de ltar stong pa nyid la gzhol ba'i bsam pas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la rtog par 'gyur zhing mtshan ma ma mchis pa dang / smon pa ma mchis pa dang / nam mkha' dang /

translated: ‚ÄúBodhisattva great beings who have the intention of being dedicated to dreams, reflections, echoes, optical illusions, magical creations, and emanations will understand this deep perfection of wisdom.‚Äù

translated: non-arising, non-cessation, non-affliction, non-purification, suchness, the dharma-constituent, the very limit of reality,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gzugs la rtog pa lags sam /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gzugs la rtog pa lags sam /

translated: The Blessed One replied, ‚ÄúSu¬≠bh≈´ti, great bodhisattva beings do not conceptualize physical forms.üîΩThey do not conceptualize feelings, perceptions, formative predispositions, and consciousness.

original: mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa rnams dang / ting nge 'dzin rnams dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams la rtog pa ma yin no //
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa rnams dang / ting nge 'dzin rnams dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams la rtog pa ma yin no //
translated: signlessness, and aspirationlessness that are doors to liberation, the aspects of the knower of paths, the aspects of the knower of bases, the aspects of the knower of all aspects, the ten powers, the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, or the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs rnams dang / mi 'jigs pa rnams dang / so so yang dag par rig pa rnams dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams la rtog pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs rnams dang / mi 'jigs pa rnams dang / so so yang dag par rig pa rnams dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams la rtog pa ma yin no //
translated: great compassion,üîΩor the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha.

analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar la rtog pa ma yin no //

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: If you ask why,

analyzed: mngon par ma byas / gang nas kyang ma 'ongs /

analyzed: gang du'ang ma song /

analyzed: phyogs na'ang mi gnas / yul na'ang mi gnas /

original: gang na'ang mi gnas pa ste /
analyzed: gang na'ang mi gnas pa ste /

original: de la grangs mi dmigs so //
analyzed: de la grangs mi dmigs so //

original: 'gro ba dang 'ong ba'ang mi dmigs so //
analyzed: 'gro ba dang 'ong ba'ang mi dmigs so //

original: gang la grangs mi dmigs shing /
analyzed: gang la grangs mi dmigs shing /
translated: In that which is not apprehended in any enumeration

original: 'gro ba dang 'ong ba mi dmigs pa de la ni /
analyzed: 'gro ba dang 'ong ba mi dmigs pa de la ni /
translated: and is not apprehended in any coming or going,

original: gang gis kyang @451a *//
analyzed: gang gis kyang @451a *//
translated: No one can fully awaken to buddhahood.

original: mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar mi nus te gzugs kyis ma yin no //
analyzed: mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar mi nus te gzugs kyis ma yin no //
translated: It is not through form that one can fully awaken to buddhahood.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pas ma yin no //
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pas ma yin no //
translated: It is not through feeling, perception, formation, or consciousness that one can fully awaken to buddhahood.

original: skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung bas ma yin no //
analyzed: skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung bas ma yin no //

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pas ma yin no //
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pas ma yin no //
translated: It is not through the perfection of generosity that one can fully awaken to buddhahood.

original: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas ma yin no //
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas ma yin no //
translated: It is not through the perfection of discipline, patience, diligence, concentration, or wisdom that one can fully awaken to buddhahood.

original: nang stong pa nyid kyis ma yin no //
analyzed: nang stong pa nyid kyis ma yin no //

analyzed: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams kyis ma yin no //

analyzed: yang dag par spong ba rnams dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams dang / dbang po rnams dang / stobs rnams dang / byang chub kyi yan lag rnams dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pas ma yin no //
translated: It is not by the right efforts, the legs of magical power, the faculties, the powers, the limbs of awakening, or the noble eightfold path.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar gyis ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar gyis ma yin no //
translated: It is not by the knowledge of all aspects.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /

analyzed: gzugs nyid kyang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid do //

original: tshor ba nyid dang / 'du shes nyid dang / 'du byed nyid dang / rnam par shes pa nyid kyang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid do //
analyzed: tshor ba nyid dang / 'du shes nyid dang / 'du byed nyid dang / rnam par shes pa nyid kyang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid do //

analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad nyid kyi bar yang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid do //

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /

translated: It is thus: the suchness of form and the suchness of the knowledge of all aspects are one suchness.üîΩThe suchness of feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness and the suchness of the knowledge of all aspects are one suchness.

original: skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i de bzhin nyid gang yin pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni de bzhin nyid gcig pa'o //
analyzed: skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i de bzhin nyid gang yin pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni de bzhin nyid gcig pa'o //
translated: The suchness of the constituents, the sense fields, and dependent origination and the suchness of the knowledge of all aspects are one suchness.

translated: the suchness of the noble truths,üîΩthe suchness of the concentrations, the suchness of the immeasurables, the suchness of the formless absorptions, the suchness of the eight deliverances, the suchness of the nine serial absorptions, the suchness of the emptiness,

translated: signlessness, and wishlessness gateways to liberation, the suchness of the clairvoyances, the suchness of the meditative stabilizations, the suchness of the dhƒÅra·πáƒ´ gateways, and the suchness of the knowledge of all aspects‚Äî

original: bzhin nyid gcig pa'o //
analyzed: bzhin nyid gcig pa'o //

translated: and

analyzed: skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba nyid rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa ste /

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyang rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'o //üîΩsbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa nyid rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa ste /

translated: The knowledge of all aspects is dependent origination.üîΩThe perfection of generosity is the knowledge of all aspects.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyang sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyang sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: The knowledge of all aspects is the perfection of generosity.

original: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa ste /

translated: The perfection of morality, the perfection of patience, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of concentration, and the perfection of wisdom are the knowledge of all aspects.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: The knowledge of all aspects is the perfection of wisdom.

original: nang stong pa nyid rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa ste /
analyzed: nang stong pa nyid rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa ste /
translated: The emptiness of internal phenomena is the knowledge of all aspects.üîΩThe knowledge of all aspects is the emptiness of internal phenomena.

translated: The knowledge of all aspects is the emptiness of emptiness.üîΩThe emptiness of great extent is the knowledge of all aspects.üîΩThe knowledge of all aspects is the emptiness of great extent.üîΩThe emptiness of ultimate reality is the knowledge of all aspects.üîΩThe knowledge of all aspects is the emptiness of ultimate reality.üîΩThe emptiness of conditioned phenomena is the knowledge of all aspects.üîΩThe knowledge of all aspects is the emptiness of conditioned phenomena.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyang dran pa nye bar bzhag pa'o //üîΩyang dag par @453a *//
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyang dran pa nye bar bzhag pa'o // yang dag par @453a *//
translated: The emptiness of unconditioned phenomena is the knowledge of all aspects.üîΩThe knowledge of all aspects is the emptiness of unconditioned phenomena.üîΩThe emptiness of the unlimited is the knowledge of all aspects.üîΩThe knowledge of all aspects is the emptiness of the unlimited.üîΩThe emptiness of that which has neither beginning nor end is the knowledge of all aspects.üîΩThe knowledge of all aspects is the emptiness of that which has neither beginning nor end.

translated: The emptiness of non-dispersal is the knowledge of all aspects.üîΩThe knowledge of all aspects is the emptiness of non-dispersal.üîΩThe emptiness of inherent existence is the knowledge of all aspects.üîΩThe knowledge of all aspects is the emptiness of inherent existence.üîΩThe emptiness of all phenomena is the knowledge of all aspects.üîΩThe knowledge of all aspects is the emptiness of all phenomena.üîΩThe emptiness of non-apprehension is the knowledge of all aspects.üîΩThe knowledge of all aspects is the emptiness of non-apprehension.üîΩThe emptiness of an intrinsic nature is the knowledge of all aspects.üîΩThe knowledge of all aspects is the emptiness of an intrinsic nature.üîΩThe emptiness of the nature of non-existence is the knowledge of all aspects.üîΩThe knowledge of all aspects is the emptiness of the nature of non-existence.üîΩThe emptiness of the nature of existence is the knowledge of all aspects.

analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyang 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa'o //
translated: The knowledge of all aspects is the emptiness of the nature of existence.üîΩThe emptiness of the nature of non-existence and existence is the knowledge of all aspects.üîΩThe knowledge of all aspects is the emptiness of the nature

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa nyid rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa ste /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa nyid rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa ste /
translated: The four noble truths, the concentrations, the immeasurables, and the formless absorptions are the knowledge of all aspects.

analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyang gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'o //

translated: The liberations, the serial absorptions, the emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness that are gateways to liberation, the clairvoyances, the concentrations,

translated: the powers of mental retention, the powers of the tathƒÅgatas, the fearlessnesses, the detailed and thorough knowledges, great love, great compassion, and the distinct attributes of a buddha are the knowledge of all aspects.

analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyang sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa'o //
translated: The knowledge of all aspects is also a buddha‚Äôs unique quality.

original: gnyis su med cing gnyis su byar med do //
analyzed: gnyis su med cing gnyis su byar med do //
translated: They are not two but indivisible.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / @453b 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa'i de bzhin nyid gang yin pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni de bzhin nyid gcig pa ste /
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / @453b 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa'i de bzhin nyid gang yin pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni de bzhin nyid gcig pa ste /
translated: The suchness of feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness and the suchness of the knowledge of all aspects are one suchness.

original: gnyis su med cing gnyis su byar med do //
analyzed: gnyis su med cing gnyis su byar med do //
translated: They are not two but indivisible.

original: skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i de bzhin nyid gang yin pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni de bzhin nyid gcig pa ste /

translated: The suchness of the constituents, the sense fields, and dependent origination and the suchness of the knowledge of all aspects are one suchness.

original: gnyis su med cing gnyis su byar med do //
analyzed: gnyis su med cing gnyis su byar med do //

analyzed: lha'i bu dag / @455a *// gzugs nyid rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa ste /

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyang gzugs so //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyang gzugs so //

analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa nyid rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa ste /

analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyang rnam par shes pa'o //

analyzed: skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba nyid rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa ste /
translated: The sense domains, constituents, and dependent origination itself is the knowledge of all aspects.

analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'o //

analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa nyid rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa ste /

translated: The perfection of morality, the perfection of patience, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of concentration, and the perfection of wisdom itself is omniscience.

analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o // nang stong pa nyid rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa ste /

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyang nang stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyang nang stong pa nyid do //

analyzed: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar du rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa ste /
translated: Up to the emptiness that is the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature is omniscience.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyang dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid do //üîΩdran pa nye bar bzhag pa nyid rnam @455b pa thams cad mkhyen pa ste /

translated: The emptiness that is the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature is also the knowledge of all aspects.üîΩThe applications of mindfulness are also the knowledge of all aspects.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyang dran pa nye bar bzhag pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyang dran pa nye bar bzhag pa'o //
translated: The knowledge of all aspects is also the applications of mindfulness.

original: yang dag par spong ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dbang po dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa nyid rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa ste /
analyzed: yang dag par spong ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dbang po dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa nyid rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa ste /
translated: The right efforts, legs of miraculous power, faculties, powers, limbs of awakening, and the noble eightfold path are also the knowledge of all aspects.

analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyang 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa'o //

analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa nyid rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa ste /

analyzed: mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa mnyam pa nyid dang / skye ba ma mchis pa dang / 'gag pa ma mchis pa mnyam pa nyid dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa ma mchis pa dang / rnam par byang ba ma mchis pa mnyam pa nyid kyi slad du thogs pa ma mchis pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: the sameness of signlessness, the sameness of wishlessness, the sameness of non-production, the sameness of non-stopping, the sameness of non-affliction, and the sameness of non-purification.

original: chos 'di ni gzugs kyi skye ba mi dmigs pa dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa'i skye ba mi dmigs pa dang / skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i skye ba mi dmigs pa dang /
analyzed: chos 'di ni gzugs kyi skye ba mi dmigs pa dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa'i skye ba mi dmigs pa dang / skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i skye ba mi dmigs pa dang /
translated: This Dharma is the non-apprehension of the production of form, and the non-apprehension of the production of feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness, and the non-apprehension of the production of the sense fields, elements, and dependent origination.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun gyi skye ba mi dmigs pa dang / 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun gyi skye ba mi dmigs pa dang / 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang /
translated: It is the non-apprehension of the production of all the perfections, all the emptinesses, and the thirty-seven dharmas on the side of awakening, and the non-apprehension of the production of the noble truths, the concentrations, the immeasurables,

original: gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'i skye ba @463b mi dmigs pa dang /
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'i skye ba @463b mi dmigs pa dang /
translated: the formless absorptions, the eight deliverances, the nine serial absorptions, emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness.

original: mngon par shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang /
analyzed: mngon par shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang /
translated: the powers, the fearlessnesses, the detailed and thorough knowledges, the great love, the great compassion,

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa'i skye ba mi dmigs pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar gyi skye ba mi dmigs pa'i slad du skye ba ma mchis pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa'i skye ba mi dmigs pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar gyi skye ba mi dmigs pa'i slad du skye ba ma mchis pa'o //
translated: the distinct attributes of a Buddha, and up to the knowledge of all aspects, because of not apprehending the production of the knowledge of all aspects.

original: chos 'di ni gzugs kyi rten mi dmigs pa dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa'i rten mi dmigs pa dang / skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i rten mi dmigs pa dang /
analyzed: chos 'di ni gzugs kyi rten mi dmigs pa dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa'i rten mi dmigs pa dang / skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i rten mi dmigs pa dang /
translated: This doctrine is the nonapprehension of the support of form, the nonapprehension of the support of feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness, the nonapprehension of the support of the constituents, the nonapprehension of the support of the sense fields, and the nonapprehension of the support of dependent origination.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun gyi rten mi dmigs pa dang / 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun gyi rten mi dmigs pa dang / 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang /
translated: the support of all the perfections, all the emptinesses, and the thirty-seven dharmas on the side of awakening, the support of the four noble truths, the concentrations, the immeasurables, and the formless absorptions,

original: rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'i rten mi dmigs pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang /
analyzed: rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'i rten mi dmigs pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang /
translated: the support of the eight deliverances, the nine serial absorptions, emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness, the support of the clairvoyances, the meditative stabilizations,

original: gzungs kyi sgo dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa dang / byams pa chen po dang / @464a *//
analyzed: gzungs kyi sgo dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa dang / byams pa chen po dang / @464a *//
translated: and the dhƒÅra·πáƒ´ gateways, the support of the powers of the tathƒÅgatas, the fearlessnesses, the detailed and thorough knowledges, great love,üîΩand great compassion, the support of the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha, and the support of the knowledge of all aspects‚Äîall those are not supported.

original: snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa'i rten mi dmigs pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar gyi rten mi dmigs pa'i slad du rten ma mchis pa'o //
analyzed: snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa'i rten mi dmigs pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar gyi rten mi dmigs pa'i slad du rten ma mchis pa'o //
translated: because the support of the great compassion, up to the support of the knowledge of all modes is not apprehended.

original: de nas 'dod pa na spyod pa dang / gzugs yod pa na spyod pa'i lha'i bu rnams kyis /
analyzed: de nas 'dod pa na spyod pa dang / gzugs yod pa na spyod pa'i lha'i bu rnams kyis /
translated: Then the gods of the realm of desire and the gods of the realm of form

original: bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: said to the Lord:

original: gnas brtan rab 'byor 'di ni bcom ldan 'das kyi rjes su skyes so //
analyzed: gnas brtan rab 'byor 'di ni bcom ldan 'das kyi rjes su skyes so //
translated: This sthavira Subh≈´ti has been born after the Lord.

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: 'di ltar gnas brtan rab 'byor ni ci dang ci ston pa de thams cad stong pa nyid brtsams shing ston te //
analyzed: 'di ltar gnas brtan rab 'byor ni ci dang ci ston pa de thams cad stong pa nyid brtsams shing ston te //
translated: Because whatever the sthavira Subh≈´ti teaches, all that he teaches as founded on emptiness,
